column1: #Data provided in this file: Summary SWE derived from snow pit depth and density profiles during the NASA SnowEx 2020 Time Series. Height of snow and a duel density profile is part of the standard snow pit protocol.
#Measurement frequency: weekly, on average, depending on site.
#Data description: Snow pit measurements occured at designated locations for the NASA SnowEx 2020 Time Series

column3: unique pit identifier: XXXXXX: 6-letter alpha(numeric) for State (2-letter), Location (2-letter), Site (2-letter) pitID; yyyymmdd; HH:MM
derived total SWE from density A profile (mm)
derived total SWE from density B profile (mm)
derived mean total SWE from duel density profile (mm)
Height of Snow (cm) with ground surface as the baseline datum
BDG=Bottom Density Gap; MDG=Middle Density Gap; TDB=Top Density Gap; AD=Additional Data; MW=Manual Wetness; STCom=Stratigraphy Comment; STLay=Stratigrapy Layer. NSIDC User Guide has more detail.

column2: Densites were not collected during the snow pit visit and there is no derived total SWE
